Milford community, we're all in this together. And small acts of kindness and selflessness during this uncertain time have the potential to make a big impact.

Last week, Clermont County Public Health asked for donations for personal protective equipment for medical personnel. One of our high school science teachers, Mrs. Van Hove, recognized that we have a stock of nitrile gloves that the students wouldn't be using while they weren't in class while school was closed. Our custodial department also donated extra stock of gloves. The health department will distribute the gloves to critical healthcare and first response agencies here in our county.

Today, our high school music department sent 13 piano keyboards to the University of Cincinnati College-Conservatory of Music - CCM. The college sent a plea requesting pianos to borrow, so their students who cannot travel home could continue with their practice.

These actions are small in the grand scheme of things, but we're happy to help when we can in any way that we can. We're all in this together, and we all play a part.

post_text: Milford Junior High's Eco-Eagles have started a campaign to rid the world of plastic. The team wants to raise awareness of how plastic is impacting our waterways. Their Plastic Free Challenge encourages individuals to do their part to eliminate plastic from their lives - bit by bit - every little bit counts. They hope to garner support from local businesses and to share the message community wide, with the ultimate goal to go viral on social media. Their campaign video features Eco-Eagle members Nicholas Kessel, Anna Chen, Kayla Blackston, and Dylan Hallinan. #LookAtMePlasticFree

PROUD MILFORD MOMENT! On Saturday the High School Wind Ensemble and Junior High Percussion Ensemble performed at the Ohio Music Education Association (OMEA) Professional Development Conference - this is a huge honor. From around the state 135 student ensembles applied, and only five bands and two percussion ensembles were invited to perform, and Milford took TWO of those slots! Way to go Eagles!

The HS Wind Ensemble comprises 55 students and the JH Percussion Ensemble comprises 17 students. The OMEA Professional Development Conference is held each year to provide clinics and concerts for music educators from across the state. The concert performances highlight outstanding student, collegiate, and professional ensembles who are presented as the best in the state in their respective categories. The concerts were held at the Duke Energy Convention Center in downtown Cincinnati.

Special thanks to Milford Band Boosters for the great photos!

Pictured here is Mrs. Vezina with her third grade class of old codgers and a group of geriatrics from Mrs. Talbert's third grade class, both from Seipelt Elementary.
